cardDescription: The Fool depicts a youthful figure carrying a bundle, standing on the edge of a cliff, with a small dog at his heels. The sun shines brightly, and mountains loom in the distance.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Fool symbolizes new beginnings, innocence, spontaneous actions, freedom, and originality.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Fool can indicate naivety, foolishness, recklessness, and risk-taking without forethought.

prominentSymbols.meaning: Represents a new journey, innocence, and being open to new experiences.
Symbolizes a leap of faith, taking risks, and being on the edge of change.
Can signify loyalty, friendship, protection, and companionship.
Represents success, vitality, enlightenment, and clarity.
Symbolize challenges, obstacles, and the need for perseverance and determination.

prominentColors.meaning: Joy, happiness, intellect, energy.
Purity, innocence, clarity, new beginnings.
Calmness, tranquility, communication, spirituality.
Growth, fertility, abundance, harmony.

cardDescription: The Magician is seen standing at a table with one hand pointed to the sky and the other pointing to the ground. Symbols of the four suits (Wands, Cups, Swords, Pentacles) are on the table, symbolizing the elements of natural power.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Magician represents manifestation, resourcefulness, power, and inspired action.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Magician can indicate manipulation, poor planning, and untapped talents.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The hand pointing upwards symbolizes the connection between the spiritual and material worlds, as above, so below.
The hand pointing downwards represents the power to manifest ideas and bring them into reality.
The four suits represent the four elements (Wands - Fire, Cups - Water, Swords - Air, Pentacles - Earth) and the ability to harness natural power.
The infinity symbol above the Magician's head represents infinite potential and the interconnectedness of all things.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion, energy, and the power to take action.
White symbolizes purity of intention and the clarity of thought needed to manifest ideas.
Yellow symbolizes the intellect and the creative mind at work.
Green symbolizes growth, abundance, and the ability to manifest material wealth.

cardDescription: The High Priestess is seated between two pillars, with a tapestry hanging between them, symbolizing the veil of awareness. She holds a Torah, representing divine knowledge.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The High Priestess represents intuition, unconscious knowledge, mystery, and spirituality.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The High Priestess can indicate secrets, being disconnected from intuition, and withdrawal and silence.

prominentSymbols.meaning: Pillars represent duality, such as light and dark, and the need to balance opposing forces.
The veil symbolizes hidden knowledge and the need to look beyond the obvious.
The Torah signifies divine knowledge and the importance of seeking wisdom.
The moon crown represents the subconscious mind and the mysteries of the night.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes intuition, depth, and the mysteries of the unknown.
Black represents the hidden, the unconscious, and the mysteries that lie beyond.
White symbolizes purity, truth, and the clarity of thought.
Yellow represents enlightenment, optimism, and the light of wisdom.

cardDescription: The Empress is depicted as a motherly figure sitting on a throne in a field of wheat, symbolizing fertility and abundance. She holds a scepter and wears a crown of stars.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Empress represents fertility, femininity, beauty, nature, and nurturing.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Empress can indicate neglect, lack of growth, smothering care, and infertility.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The throne symbolizes authority, power, and the ability to nurture and protect.
The wheat field represents fertility, abundance, and the cycles of nature.
The scepter symbolizes authority, leadership, and the power to create and nurture.
The crown of stars represents divine guidance, intuition, and the connection to higher realms.

prominentColors.meaning: Green symbolizes growth, fertility, and the nurturing aspects of nature.
Yellow symbolizes joy, optimism, and the creative energy of the sun.
Red symbolizes passion, vitality, and the life force that sustains all living things.
Blue symbolizes intuition, depth, and the calming influence of water.

cardDescription: The Emperor sits on a throne adorned with rams' heads, symbolizing authority and power. He holds an orb and a scepter, representing the world and his control over it.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Emperor represents authority, structure, control, fatherhood, and leadership.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Emperor can indicate tyranny, rigidity, coldness, and overbearing power.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The throne symbolizes authority, power, and the establishment of order.
The rams' heads represent determination, power, and the ability to overcome obstacles.
The orb symbolizes the world and the Emperor's control over his domain.
The scepter symbolizes authority, leadership, and the Emperor's power to rule.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion, power, and the Emperor's ability to take action.
Yellow symbolizes intellect, clarity, and the Emperor's wisdom in decision-making.
Blue symbolizes stability, trustworthiness, and the Emperor's commitment to order.
White symbolizes purity, authority, and the Emperor's impartiality in judgment.

cardDescription: The Hierophant is depicted as a religious figure sitting between two pillars, similar to The High Priestess. He wears a papal crown and holds a scepter.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Hierophant represents tradition, conformity, morality, and religious beliefs.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Hierophant can indicate rebellion, subversiveness, new approaches, and unconventional thinking.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The pillars symbolize duality, balance, and the gateway between the physical and spiritual worlds.
The papal crown symbolizes authority, leadership, and divine connection.
The scepter symbolizes power, authority, and the Hierophant's role as a spiritual leader.
The cross symbolizes faith, sacrifice, and spiritual teachings.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion, power, and the Hierophant's dedication to his beliefs.
Blue symbolizes wisdom, truth, and the Hierophant's connection to the divine.
Yellow symbolizes enlightenment, clarity, and the Hierophant's spiritual guidance.
White symbolizes purity, holiness, and the Hierophant's commitment to righteousness.

cardDescription: The Lovers card shows a man and a woman in a garden, with an angel blessing them from above. The card symbolizes harmony, relationships, and choices.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Lovers card represents love, harmony, relationships, values alignment, and choices.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Lovers card can indicate disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values, and difficult choices.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The man symbolizes masculinity, logic, and the conscious mind.
The woman symbolizes femininity, intuition, and the subconscious mind.
The angel symbolizes divine guidance, blessings, and spiritual connection.
The tree symbolizes growth, life, and the natural world.
The serpent symbolizes temptation, transformation, and the cycle of life and death.

prominentColors.meaning: Green symbolizes nature, fertility, and growth, reflecting the harmony and balance of The Lovers.
Red symbolizes passion, desire, and love, highlighting the emotional connection between the man and woman.
Blue symbolizes communication, wisdom, and truth, suggesting the importance of honest and open dialogue in relationships.
Yellow symbolizes positivity, joy, and enlightenment, representing the blessings and divine guidance of the angel.

cardDescription: The Chariot depicts a warrior riding a chariot, pulled by two sphinxes of opposite colors. The card represents control, willpower, and victory.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Chariot represents control, willpower, success, action, and determination.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Chariot can indicate lack of control, lack of direction, aggression, and failure.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The chariot symbolizes travel, progression, and control over one's path.
The sphinxes represent opposing forces or aspects of the self, requiring balance and control.
The armor symbolizes protection, strength, and preparedness for battle.
The city in the background symbolizes civilization, progress, and the destination of the chariot's journey.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes energy, vitality, and confidence, reflecting the dynamic nature of The Chariot.
Blue symbolizes stability, control, and communication, emphasizing the need for clear direction and purpose.
Black symbolizes mystery, the unknown, and hidden forces, suggesting challenges or obstacles to overcome.
White symbolizes purity, clarity, and spiritual enlightenment, indicating the spiritual guidance and purity of intention needed for victory.

cardDescription: Strength shows a woman gently closing the jaws of a lion. The card symbolizes inner strength, courage, and compassion.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, Strength represents strength, courage, patience, control, and compassion.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, Strength can indicate weakness, self-doubt, lack of self-discipline, and cowardice.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The woman symbolizes inner strength, nurturing, and feminine power.
The lion represents courage, strength, and the raw, primal aspects of the self.
The lemniscate, or infinity symbol, signifies infinite strength, balance, and harmony.
The mountains in the background represent obstacles, challenges, and the need for perseverance.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes energy, joy, and optimism, reflecting the inner strength and courage of the woman.
Green symbolizes growth, healing, and renewal, suggesting the compassionate and nurturing nature of strength.
Red symbolizes passion, courage, and vitality, highlighting the fierce determination and courage needed to face challenges.
Blue symbolizes peace, tranquility, and clarity, indicating the calm control and patience required to manage difficult situations.

cardDescription: The Hermit stands alone on a mountain peak, holding a lantern and a staff. The card represents introspection, solitude, and guidance.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Hermit represents introspection, solitude, guidance, contemplation, and inner wisdom.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Hermit can indicate loneliness, isolation, feeling lost, withdrawal, and paranoia.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The mountain symbolizes challenges, obstacles, and the journey to enlightenment.
The lantern represents inner guidance, wisdom, and the search for truth in the darkness.
The staff symbolizes authority, wisdom, and the journey of self-discovery.
The cloak symbolizes protection, concealment, and the need for introspection and solitude.

prominentColors.meaning: Gray symbolizes neutrality, wisdom, and balance, reflecting the introspective nature of The Hermit's journey.
Yellow symbolizes enlightenment, joy, and clarity, representing the inner wisdom and guidance The Hermit seeks.
Blue symbolizes peace, tranquility, and intuition, suggesting the calm contemplation and guidance provided by The Hermit.
White symbolizes purity, clarity, and spiritual enlightenment, indicating the spiritual guidance and truth The Hermit seeks.

cardDescription: The Wheel of Fortune features a large wheel surrounded by various creatures and symbols. It represents cycles, change, and the ups and downs of life.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Wheel of Fortune represents good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny, and a turning point.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Wheel of Fortune can indicate bad luck, resistance to change, breaking cycles, and unforeseen events.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The wheel symbolizes the cycles of life, fate, and the interconnectedness of all things.
The creatures symbolize the four fixed signs of the zodiac and the continuous cycle of change and evolution.
The symbols represent the ever-changing nature of life and the lessons to be learned from each cycle.
The clouds symbolize uncertainty and the unpredictable nature of fate and destiny.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes stability, trust, and calmness, suggesting the need to trust in the natural cycles of life.
Yellow symbolizes positivity, energy, and optimism, indicating a turning point or change for the better.
Red symbolizes passion, action, and vitality, suggesting a period of transformation and change.
Green symbolizes growth, renewal, and balance, indicating a time of positive change and new opportunities.

cardDescription: Justice depicts a figure seated on a throne, holding a sword in one hand and scales in the other. It symbolizes fairness, truth, and the law.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, Justice represents justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect, and the law.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, Justice can indicate unfairness, lack of accountability, dishonesty, and injustice.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The scales symbolize balance, fairness, and the weighing of decisions.
The sword symbolizes truth, justice, and the power of reason and intellect.
The throne symbolizes authority, power, and the seat of judgment.
The pillar symbolizes stability, strength, and the support of justice and truth.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion, action, and justice, suggesting the need for action and fairness.
Blue symbolizes truth, clarity, and justice, indicating a need for honesty and integrity.
Yellow symbolizes clarity, wisdom, and intellect, suggesting the need for rational judgment.
White symbolizes purity, truth, and fairness, indicating a need for impartiality and objectivity.

cardDescription: The Hanged Man is depicted hanging upside-down by one foot from a tree. It represents sacrifice, new perspectives, and surrender.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Hanged Man represents a pause, surrender, letting go, and new perspectives.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Hanged Man can indicate delays, resistance, stalling, and indecision.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The tree symbolizes life, growth, and connection to the earth, suggesting the need to look at things from a different perspective.
The halo symbolizes enlightenment, spiritual awakening, and divine guidance, indicating a need to surrender to a higher power or wisdom.
The bound foot symbolizes sacrifice, restriction, and surrender, suggesting the need to let go of control and accept a new way of thinking.
The serenity of the figure's expression symbolizes peace, acceptance, and tranquility, indicating the benefits of surrender and acceptance.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes calmness, introspection, and intuition, suggesting the need to reflect on one's situation and find inner peace.
Green symbolizes growth, renewal, and harmony with nature, indicating the need for a fresh perspective and new beginnings.
Yellow symbolizes enlightenment, positivity, and clarity, suggesting the need to see things from a different angle and embrace change.
Red symbolizes passion, action, and courage, indicating the need to take bold steps and face challenges with determination.

cardDescription: Death depicts a skeleton riding a white horse, with people of different social statuses lying in its path. It symbolizes endings, transformation, and renewal.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, Death represents endings, change, transformation, and transition.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, Death can indicate resistance to change, personal transformation, and inner purging.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The skeleton symbolizes the end of life, mortality, and the impermanence of existence, suggesting the need to accept endings and embrace change.
The white horse symbolizes purity, spirit, and the journey of the soul, indicating a transition to a new phase of life or a spiritual transformation.
The fallen figures represent people from different social statuses, symbolizing the universal nature of death and the leveling of all individuals in its path.
The rising sun symbolizes new beginnings, hope, and the promise of a new day, suggesting that death is not the end but a new beginning.

prominentColors.meaning: Black symbolizes death, mourning, and the unknown, suggesting the need to confront fears and embrace the mysteries of life.
White symbolizes purity, innocence, and spiritual awakening, indicating a transformation or purification process.
Yellow symbolizes enlightenment, clarity, and optimism, suggesting that death brings understanding and a new perspective.
Blue symbolizes tranquility, peace, and acceptance, indicating the need to find peace with the natural cycle of life and death.

cardDescription: Temperance depicts an angelic figure pouring water between two cups, symbolizing balance, moderation, and harmony.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, Temperance represents balance, moderation, patience, purpose, and meaning.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, Temperance can indicate imbalance, excess, self-healing, and re-alignment.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The angel symbolizes divine intervention, guidance, and spiritual connection, suggesting the need to find a higher purpose or spiritual path.
Water symbolizes emotions, intuition, and the subconscious mind, indicating the need to balance and harmonize emotions.
The cups symbolize emotions, relationships, and the heart, suggesting the need to find harmony and balance in relationships.
The path symbolizes the journey of life, indicating the need to find balance and moderation on life's path.
Mountains symbolize challenges, obstacles, and the need for perseverance, suggesting the need to overcome challenges with patience and moderation.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes tranquility, peace, and calmness, suggesting the need to find inner peace and balance.
Yellow symbolizes joy, happiness, and positivity, indicating the need to approach life with optimism and enthusiasm.
Red symbolizes passion, energy, and action, suggesting the need to take decisive action with moderation and balance.
White symbolizes purity, clarity, and spiritual awakening, indicating the need to find spiritual balance and harmony.

cardDescription: The Devil shows a horned figure with two chained figures beneath him. It represents bondage, materialism, and the shadow self.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Devil represents bondage, addiction, sexuality, and materialism.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Devil can indicate release, freedom, reclaiming power, and breaking chains.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The horned figure symbolizes temptation, desire, and the shadow self, suggesting the need to confront and overcome inner demons.
The chains symbolize bondage and restriction, indicating the need to break free from limiting beliefs or situations.
The flames symbolize passion, desire, and transformation, suggesting the need to channel desires in a positive direction.
The nude figures symbolize vulnerability and exposure, indicating the need to confront fears and insecurities.

prominentColors.meaning: Black symbolizes darkness, mystery, and the unknown, suggesting the need to explore hidden aspects of the self.
Red symbolizes passion, desire, and intensity, indicating the need to harness and control powerful emotions.
Gray symbolizes neutrality and balance, suggesting the need to find a balance between extremes.
Yellow symbolizes clarity, intellect, and illumination, indicating the need to shed light on dark or hidden aspects of the self.

cardDescription: The Tower depicts a tall tower struck by lightning, with figures falling from it. It symbolizes sudden change, upheaval, and revelation.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Tower represents sudden change, upheaval, chaos, revelation, and awakening.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Tower can indicate personal transformation, fear of change, and averting disaster.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The tower symbolizes a structure built on false beliefs or shaky foundations, suggesting the need to rebuild and start anew.
Lightning symbolizes a sudden and unexpected event or realization, indicating the need to embrace change and let go of the past.
The falling figures symbolize destruction and chaos, suggesting the need to surrender to forces beyond control.
Fire symbolizes destruction and purification, indicating the need to let go of what no longer serves for new growth to occur.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion, intensity, and upheaval, suggesting the need to channel energy into positive transformation.
Yellow symbolizes illumination and insight, indicating the need to embrace change and seek higher understanding.
Gray symbolizes neutrality and detachment, suggesting the need to step back and reassess the situation.
Blue symbolizes clarity and calmness, indicating the need to stay grounded and focused during times of upheaval.

cardDescription: The Star shows a naked woman pouring water into a pool and onto the land, with stars shining above. It represents hope, inspiration, and serenity.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Star represents hope, faith, inspiration, spirituality, and renewal.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Star can indicate lack of faith, despair, self-trust, and disconnection.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The naked woman symbolizes vulnerability and openness, suggesting the need to be authentic and true to oneself.
Stars symbolize hope and guidance, indicating the need to trust in a higher purpose or divine plan.
Water symbolizes emotions and intuition, suggesting the need to listen to one's inner voice and follow one's heart.
The bird symbolizes freedom and transcendence, indicating the need to rise above challenges and limitations.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes peace and tranquility, suggesting the need to find inner calm and clarity.
Yellow symbolizes optimism and joy, indicating the need to stay positive and hopeful.
Green symbolizes growth and healing, suggesting the need to nurture oneself and others.
White symbolizes purity and clarity, indicating the need to let go of negativity and embrace purity of spirit.

cardDescription: The Moon features a night scene with a full moon, two towers, a wolf, a dog howling, and a crayfish emerging from water. It symbolizes intuition, fear, and the subconscious.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Moon represents illusion, fear, anxiety, the subconscious, and intuition.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Moon can indicate the release of fear, repressed emotion, inner clarity, and facing fears.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The moon symbolizes the subconscious mind, emotions, and cycles, suggesting the need to trust in the unknown and navigate through uncertainty.
The wolf symbolizes instinct, intuition, and the wild, indicating the need to listen to one's inner voice and primal instincts.
The dog symbolizes loyalty and companionship, suggesting the need for emotional support and guidance.
The crayfish symbolizes regeneration and renewal, indicating the need to let go of the past and embrace new beginnings.
The towers symbolize illusion and deception, suggesting the need to look beyond surface appearances and uncover hidden truths.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes intuition and inner knowing, suggesting the need to trust in one's instincts and follow one's inner guidance.
Yellow symbolizes illumination and clarity, indicating the need to shine light on the subconscious and uncover hidden fears.
Black symbolizes the unknown and the subconscious mind, suggesting the need to explore the depths of one's psyche and confront fears.
White symbolizes purity and spiritual growth, indicating the need to find clarity and peace within oneself.

cardDescription: The Sun shows a joyful child riding a white horse under the bright sun, surrounded by sunflowers. It represents success, vitality, and joy.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The Sun represents positivity, fun, warmth, success, and vitality.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The Sun can indicate negativity, depression, sadness, and lack of clarity.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The child symbolizes innocence, joy, and new beginnings, suggesting the need to approach life with a fresh perspective and open heart.
The white horse symbolizes purity, freedom, and spiritual growth, indicating the need to embrace your true self and follow your path with confidence.
The sun symbolizes success, vitality, and enlightenment, suggesting the need to shine brightly and embrace opportunities for growth and transformation.
Sunflowers symbolize joy, happiness, and optimism, indicating the need to focus on the positive aspects of life and cultivate a sense of gratitude.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes happiness, positivity, and enlightenment, suggesting the need to stay optimistic and focus on the bright side of life.
White symbolizes purity, clarity, and new beginnings, indicating the need to let go of the past and embrace a fresh start.
Green symbolizes growth, abundance, and vitality, suggesting the need to nurture your dreams and cultivate a sense of well-being.
Red symbolizes passion, energy, and vitality, indicating the need to take action and pursue your goals with enthusiasm.

cardDescription: Judgement depicts an angel blowing a trumpet, with people rising from their graves. It symbolizes rebirth, inner calling, and absolution.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, Judgement represents judgement, rebirth, inner calling, and absolution.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, Judgement can indicate self-doubt, failure to learn lessons, and the need for self-examination.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The angel symbolizes divine intervention, guidance, and awakening, suggesting the need to listen to your inner voice and follow your spiritual path.
The trumpet symbolizes awakening, revelation, and the call to action, indicating the need to heed the call of destiny and embrace change.
The rising figures symbolize rebirth, renewal, and transformation, suggesting the need to let go of the past and embrace a new beginning.
The cross symbolizes sacrifice, redemption, and faith, indicating the need to make sacrifices for a greater good and have faith in the future.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes spirituality, intuition, and inner peace, suggesting the need to connect with your spiritual side and trust your instincts.
Red symbolizes passion, vitality, and action, indicating the need to take bold steps and pursue your goals with determination.
White symbolizes purity, clarity, and new beginnings, suggesting the need to let go of the past and embrace a fresh start.
Yellow symbolizes enlightenment, positivity, and joy, indicating the need to stay optimistic and focus on the bright side of life.

cardDescription: The World shows a figure surrounded by a laurel wreath, with symbols of the four elements in each corner. It represents completion, accomplishment, and unity.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, The World represents completion, accomplishment, travel, fulfillment, and harmony.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, The World can indicate incompletion, lack of closure, lack of achievement, and stagnation.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The laurel wreath symbolizes victory, success, and achievement, suggesting the need to celebrate your accomplishments and acknowledge your hard work.
The symbols of the four elements (earth, air, fire, water) represent balance and harmony, indicating the need to find balance in all aspects of your life.
The dancing figure symbolizes joy, celebration, and freedom, suggesting the need to embrace life with enthusiasm and optimism.
The ribbon symbolizes unity and completion, indicating the need to tie up loose ends and bring projects to a successful conclusion.

prominentColors.meaning: Green symbolizes growth, renewal, and harmony, suggesting the need to nurture your relationships and personal growth.
Blue symbolizes peace, tranquility, and communication, indicating the need to express yourself clearly and listen to others.
Red symbolizes passion, energy, and action, suggesting the need to take bold steps and pursue your goals with determination.
Yellow symbolizes enlightenment, positivity, and joy, indicating the need to stay optimistic and focus on the bright side of life.

cardDescription: The Ace of Wands depicts a hand holding a budding wand, symbolizing new beginnings, inspiration, and potential.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Ace of Wands represents new beginnings, inspiration, creativity, and potential.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Ace of Wands can indicate delays, lack of motivation, wasted potential, and feeling uninspired.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The hand symbolizes action and creativity, suggesting the need to take action and pursue your passions.
The budding wand symbolizes new beginnings and potential, indicating the start of a new journey or project.
The landscape represents the fertile ground for growth and creativity, suggesting that now is the time to plant seeds for the future.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes energy, creativity, and positivity, suggesting that now is the time to be optimistic and take action.
Green symbolizes growth, vitality, and abundance, indicating that now is the time for new growth and opportunities.
Blue symbolizes communication, inspiration, and intuition, suggesting that now is the time to listen to your inner voice and trust your instincts.
Brown symbolizes stability, grounding, and practicality, indicating that now is the time to be practical and realistic in your endeavors.

cardDescription: The Two of Wands shows a figure holding a globe, looking out over a landscape. It represents future planning, progress, decisions, and discovery.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Two of Wands represents future planning, progress, decisions, and discovery.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Two of Wands can indicate fear of change, indecision, lack of planning, and feeling overwhelmed.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The figure represents someone who is at a crossroads, needing to make a decision or choose a path forward.
The globe symbolizes the world of possibilities and opportunities that are available, suggesting the need to think globally and consider the bigger picture.
The landscape represents the vastness of the future and the unknown, suggesting the need to explore and be open to new experiences.
The wand symbolizes creativity, energy, and action, suggesting that now is the time to take the first steps towards your goals.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion, energy, and action, suggesting that now is the time to be bold and take risks.
Blue symbolizes communication, intuition, and clarity, suggesting that now is the time to listen to your inner voice and trust your instincts.
Yellow symbolizes optimism, joy, and positivity, suggesting that now is the time to be optimistic about the future.
Green symbolizes growth, abundance, and prosperity, suggesting that now is the time for personal and professional growth.

cardDescription: The Three of Wands depicts a figure looking out over a vast landscape, with three wands standing firmly. It symbolizes exploration, foresight, and expansion.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Three of Wands represents expansion, foresight, overseas opportunities, and long-term plans.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Three of Wands can indicate delays, obstacles, frustration, and a lack of foresight.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The figure represents someone who is looking out into the future with optimism and confidence, ready to explore new opportunities.
The landscape symbolizes the vast possibilities and opportunities that lie ahead, suggesting that now is the time to think big and expand your horizons.
The three wands standing firmly symbolize stability and strength, suggesting that your plans are well-founded and likely to succeed.
The sea symbolizes the unknown and unexplored, suggesting that now is the time to venture into new territories and take risks.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion, energy, and action, suggesting that now is the time to take bold steps towards your goals.
Green symbolizes growth, abundance, and prosperity, suggesting that your plans are likely to lead to success and prosperity.
Blue symbolizes communication, intuition, and clarity, suggesting that you have a clear vision of where you want to go and how to get there.
Yellow symbolizes optimism, joy, and positivity, suggesting that your future is bright and full of opportunities.

cardDescription: The Four of Wands depicts a celebration with a background of a castle. It represents community, homecoming, and joy.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Four of Wands represents celebration, joy, harmony, relaxation, and homecoming.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Four of Wands can indicate a lack of support, feeling unwelcome, transient joy, and instability.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The celebration symbolizes a time of happiness and joy, suggesting that you should take the time to celebrate your achievements and enjoy the moment.
The castle symbolizes stability and security, suggesting that you are in a safe and comfortable place in your life.
The four wands represent a solid foundation and support, suggesting that you have the support of friends and family in your endeavors.
The garlands symbolize decoration and festivity, suggesting that now is a time for celebration and enjoyment.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes joy, happiness, and optimism, suggesting that this is a time of celebration and happiness.
Red symbolizes passion, energy, and excitement, suggesting that the celebration will be lively and enjoyable.
Green symbolizes growth, harmony, and balance, suggesting that the celebration will bring a sense of peace and harmony.
Blue symbolizes tranquility, calmness, and stability, suggesting that the celebration will be a peaceful and enjoyable experience.

cardDescription: The Five of Wands shows five people holding wands and appearing to be in conflict. It represents competition, conflict, and disagreement.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Five of Wands represents conflict, competition, disagreements, tension, and diversity.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Five of Wands can indicate avoiding conflict, respecting differences, and finding common ground.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The five people symbolize different perspectives and personalities, suggesting that there are multiple viewpoints in the situation.
The wands symbolize conflict and competition, suggesting that there is a struggle for dominance or control.
The struggle symbolizes the challenges and obstacles that must be overcome, suggesting that there is a need to find a resolution.
The disarray symbolizes confusion and disorder, suggesting that there is a lack of clarity or direction in the situation.

prominentColors.meaning: Orange symbolizes energy and enthusiasm, suggesting that there is a lot of activity and movement in the situation.
Yellow symbolizes intellect and communication, suggesting that there may be misunderstandings or miscommunications causing the conflict.
Blue symbolizes calmness and stability, suggesting that there is a need to remain calm and composed in the face of conflict.
Green symbolizes growth and harmony, suggesting that there is a need to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.

cardDescription: The Six of Wands depicts a figure riding a horse, holding a wand with a wreath. It symbolizes victory, success, and recognition.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Six of Wands represents victory, success, public recognition, progress, and self-confidence.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Six of Wands can indicate failure, lack of recognition, lack of achievement, and a fall from grace.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The figure on the horse symbolizes leadership and triumph, suggesting that you are in a position of power and authority.
The wreath symbolizes victory and achievement, suggesting that you have accomplished your goals and are being rewarded for your efforts.
The crowd symbolizes recognition and admiration, suggesting that others are celebrating your success and achievements.
The six wands symbolize success and victory, suggesting that you have achieved a significant milestone or goal.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion and energy, suggesting that you are driven to succeed and achieve your goals.
Yellow symbolizes joy and happiness, suggesting that your success is bringing you great satisfaction and fulfillment.
White symbolizes purity and innocence, suggesting that your success is well-deserved and untainted.
Green symbolizes growth and prosperity, suggesting that your success will lead to further opportunities and advancements.

cardDescription: The Seven of Wands shows a figure standing on a hill, defending against opponents. It represents standing one's ground, perseverance, and challenge.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Seven of Wands represents perseverance, defensive posture, maintaining control, and facing challenges head-on.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Seven of Wands can indicate giving up, feeling overwhelmed, yielding to pressure, and lacking confidence.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The figure on the hill symbolizes the need to defend your position or beliefs, suggesting that you may face opposition or challenges.
The opponents symbolize external challenges or obstacles that you must overcome, suggesting that you may need to fight for what you believe in.
The seven wands symbolize resilience and determination, suggesting that you have the strength and courage to face whatever comes your way.
The defensive stance of the figure symbolizes the need to stand your ground and protect your interests, suggesting that you may need to be assertive and determined.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion and determination, suggesting that you are fiercely committed to your goals and beliefs.
Yellow symbolizes courage and confidence, suggesting that you have the strength and conviction to face challenges.
Green symbolizes growth and resilience, suggesting that you have the ability to adapt and overcome obstacles.
Blue symbolizes calmness and stability, suggesting that you can maintain your composure and focus under pressure.

cardDescription: The Eight of Wands shows eight wands flying through the air, symbolizing swift action, movement, and rapid change.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Eight of Wands represents rapid action, movement, quick decisions, and swift changes. It indicates that things are progressing quickly and you may need to act fast to keep up.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Eight of Wands can indicate delays, frustration, resisting change, and internal conflict. It suggests that things may not be progressing as quickly as you'd like, and you may need to address any internal conflicts or resistance to change.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The eight wands flying through the air symbolize swift action and movement, suggesting that things are happening quickly or that you need to act fast.
The speed at which the wands are moving symbolizes rapid change and progress, suggesting that things are moving forward swiftly.
The movement of the wands symbolizes forward momentum and progress, suggesting that things are in motion and progressing quickly.
The river in the background symbolizes the flow of energy and change, suggesting that change is inevitable and happening swiftly.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes energy and action, suggesting that you may need to take swift action or make quick decisions.
Green symbolizes growth and progress, suggesting that things are moving forward rapidly.
Blue symbolizes communication and clarity, suggesting that you may need to communicate clearly and quickly to keep up with the pace of change.
Red symbolizes passion and urgency, suggesting that you may need to act quickly and decisively.

cardDescription: The Nine of Wands shows a figure standing guard with a bandaged head, surrounded by nine wands. It represents resilience, persistence, and boundaries.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Nine of Wands represents resilience, courage, persistence, a test of faith, and boundaries. It suggests that you have been through challenges but have the strength to continue and defend your position.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Nine of Wands can indicate inner resources, struggle, overwhelm, defensiveness, and paranoia. It suggests that you may be feeling overwhelmed or defensive, and it may be time to reassess your boundaries and approach to challenges.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The bandaged figure represents someone who has been through challenges but remains strong and resilient.
The nine wands surrounding the figure symbolize resilience, persistence, and the ability to defend one's position.
The mountains in the background symbolize the challenges that the figure has faced and overcome.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes resilience and optimism, suggesting that you have the strength to overcome challenges.
Green symbolizes growth and renewal, suggesting that you are able to grow and learn from your experiences.
Red symbolizes passion and strength, suggesting that you have the passion and strength to persevere.
Blue symbolizes calmness and stability, suggesting that you are able to remain calm and stable in the face of challenges.

cardDescription: The Ten of Wands depicts a figure carrying a heavy load of ten wands. It symbolizes burden, responsibility, and hard work.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Ten of Wands represents burden, responsibility, hard work, stress, and achievement. It suggests that you may be feeling overwhelmed by your responsibilities but that you have the strength and determination to see them through.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Ten of Wands can indicate release, letting go, feeling overwhelmed, and having too much to bear. It suggests that you may need to delegate or let go of some of your burdens to avoid becoming overwhelmed.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The figure carrying the wands symbolizes someone who is burdened by responsibilities but is determined to see them through.
The ten wands symbolize the burdens and responsibilities that the figure is carrying.
The burden represents the weight of responsibility and hard work that the figure is carrying.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes optimism and energy, suggesting that you have the energy and determination to complete your tasks.
Red symbolizes passion and action, suggesting that you are driven by a strong sense of purpose.
Green symbolizes growth and renewal, suggesting that your burdens may lead to personal growth and development.
Brown symbolizes stability and grounding, suggesting that you have a solid foundation to support you through your challenges.

cardDescription: The Page of Wands shows a young figure holding a staff, looking at it with curiosity. It represents enthusiasm, exploration, and discovery.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Page of Wands represents enthusiasm, exploration, discovery, and a free spirit. It suggests that you are full of energy and excitement for new opportunities and adventures.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Page of Wands can indicate a lack of direction, procrastination, and creating conflict. It suggests that you may be feeling restless or unsure about your path, leading to indecision or conflict with others.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The young figure represents youthfulness, energy, and a willingness to embrace new experiences.
The staff symbolizes potential and the beginning of a journey or adventure.
The desert represents the vast expanse of opportunities and adventures that lie ahead, waiting to be explored.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes enthusiasm and optimism, suggesting that you are ready to embrace new challenges.
Red symbolizes passion and energy, suggesting that you are driven by a strong sense of purpose.
Blue symbolizes introspection and wisdom, suggesting that you are open to learning and discovering new things.
Green symbolizes growth and renewal, suggesting that you are ready to grow and develop through new experiences.

cardDescription: The Knight of Wands shows a knight in armor riding a horse, representing energy, passion, and adventure.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Knight of Wands represents energy, passion, adventure, impulsiveness, and travel. It suggests that you are full of energy and ready to embark on new adventures or projects.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Knight of Wands can indicate haste, scattered energy, delays, and frustration. It suggests that you may be rushing into things without proper planning or facing obstacles that slow your progress.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The knight symbolizes action, movement, and a willingness to pursue your goals.
The horse represents strength, power, and the drive to move forward.
The armor symbolizes protection and readiness for battle, suggesting that you are prepared to face challenges head-on.
The wands symbolize creativity, passion, and the pursuit of goals and desires.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion, energy, and action, suggesting that you are driven by your desires and goals.
Yellow symbolizes optimism and enthusiasm, suggesting that you are excited about the opportunities ahead.
Green symbolizes growth and vitality, suggesting that you are ready to grow and expand your horizons.
Blue symbolizes wisdom and introspection, suggesting that you may need to consider your actions carefully before proceeding.

cardDescription: The Queen of Wands sits on her throne, holding a wand and a sunflower, embodying confidence, warmth, and determination.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Queen of Wands represents confidence, warmth, determination, vibrancy, and independence. She embodies the qualities of a natural leader who is passionate about her pursuits and inspires others with her enthusiasm.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Queen of Wands can indicate overbearing behavior, being demanding, jealousy, and deceit. It suggests that you may need to be mindful of your actions and their impact on others.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The queen symbolizes leadership, confidence, and independence, suggesting that you have the ability to take charge of your life and pursue your goals.
The throne symbolizes authority and power, suggesting that you have the strength and determination to overcome challenges.
The sunflower symbolizes warmth, positivity, and vitality, suggesting that you bring joy and energy to those around you.
The lion symbolizes courage and strength, suggesting that you have the inner strength to face any challenges that come your way.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes confidence and positivity, suggesting that you approach life with a bright and optimistic outlook.
Red symbolizes passion and energy, suggesting that you are driven by your desires and goals.
Green symbolizes growth and vitality, suggesting that you are constantly evolving and expanding your horizons.
Orange symbolizes creativity and enthusiasm, suggesting that you are full of creative energy and ideas.

cardDescription: The King of Wands is a natural leader, depicted on his throne, which is adorned with lions and salamanders, symbolizing strength and transformation.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the King of Wands represents a natural leader, vision, entrepreneurship, honor, and being a force of nature. He embodies the qualities of a charismatic leader who inspires others with his ideas and actions.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the King of Wands can indicate impulsiveness, being overbearing, having unrealistic expectations, and tyranny. It suggests that you may need to temper your actions and consider the impact they have on others.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The king symbolizes leadership, authority, and influence, suggesting that you have the ability to lead and inspire others.
The throne symbolizes power and authority, suggesting that you have the strength and determination to achieve your goals.
The lion symbolizes courage and strength, suggesting that you have the inner strength to face challenges.
The salamander symbolizes transformation and regeneration, suggesting that you have the ability to adapt and change in any situation.

prominentColors.meaning: Orange symbolizes creativity and enthusiasm, suggesting that you approach life with passion and energy.
Yellow symbolizes confidence and positivity, suggesting that you have a bright and optimistic outlook.
Red symbolizes passion and action, suggesting that you are driven by your desires and goals.
Green symbolizes growth and renewal, suggesting that you are constantly evolving and improving.

cardDescription: The Ace of Cups depicts a hand holding a cup overflowing with water, symbolizing new beginnings, emotional fulfillment, and intuition.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Ace of Cups represents new beginnings, emotional fulfillment, intuition, and creativity. It signifies the start of a new emotional journey or a deepening of existing emotional bonds.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Ace of Cups can indicate emotional loss, blocked creativity, emptiness, or unfulfilled love. It suggests that you may need to address your emotional needs or explore new ways to express your feelings.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The hand symbolizes offering or receiving, suggesting openness to new emotional experiences.
The overflowing cup symbolizes abundance and emotional fulfillment, suggesting a wealth of positive emotions.
Water symbolizes emotions and intuition, suggesting a deep connection to your feelings and inner guidance.
The dove symbolizes peace and love, suggesting harmonious relationships and emotional healing.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes tranquility and calmness, suggesting emotional stability and serenity.
White symbolizes purity and spirituality, suggesting a clear and open heart.
Yellow symbolizes joy and happiness, suggesting a positive and uplifting emotional state.
Green symbolizes growth and healing, suggesting emotional renewal and transformation.

cardDescription: The Two of Cups shows two people exchanging cups, symbolizing partnership, unity, and emotional connection.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Two of Cups represents partnership, unity, emotional connection, and mutual attraction. It signifies the beginning of a meaningful relationship or a deepening bond between two people.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Two of Cups can indicate miscommunication, breakups, imbalance, or tension in relationships. It suggests that there may be challenges or conflicts that need to be addressed in order to maintain harmony.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The two people symbolize a partnership or relationship, suggesting a strong emotional bond.
The exchange of cups symbolizes the sharing of emotions and feelings, suggesting mutual understanding and connection.
The caduceus symbolizes healing and transformation, suggesting the potential for emotional growth and renewal in relationships.
The lion's head symbolizes courage and strength, suggesting the need for bravery and resilience in relationships.

prominentColors.meaning: Red symbolizes passion and love, suggesting a deep emotional connection.
Blue symbolizes communication and understanding, suggesting a harmonious relationship.
Yellow symbolizes happiness and optimism, suggesting a positive and uplifting partnership.
Green symbolizes growth and renewal, suggesting the potential for emotional development in the relationship.

cardDescription: The Three of Cups depicts three people celebrating together, symbolizing friendship, community, and joy.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Three of Cups represents friendship, community, celebration, collaboration, and joy. It signifies coming together with others to share happiness and good times.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Three of Cups can indicate overindulgence, gossip, isolation, or conflicts in friendship. It suggests that there may be issues in relationships or social interactions that need to be addressed.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The three people symbolize friendship and community, suggesting a sense of belonging and camaraderie.
The celebration symbolizes joy and happiness, suggesting a time of festivity and shared enjoyment.
The cups symbolize emotions and relationships, suggesting a focus on emotional connections and shared experiences.
The fruit symbolizes abundance and prosperity, suggesting a time of plenty and shared blessings.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes happiness and optimism, suggesting a positive and joyful atmosphere.
Green symbolizes growth and harmony, suggesting a sense of balance and unity in the celebration.
Red symbolizes passion and vitality, suggesting a lively and energetic gathering.
Blue symbolizes communication and understanding, suggesting open and meaningful interactions.

cardDescription: The Four of Cups shows a figure contemplating three cups while a fourth is offered. It represents contemplation, apathy, and missed opportunities.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Four of Cups represents contemplation, apathy, missed opportunities, and dissatisfaction. It suggests a period of introspection and contemplation, but warns against becoming too focused on what is lacking and missing out on new opportunities.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Four of Cups can indicate new opportunities, reevaluation, newfound interest, or overcoming apathy. It suggests a shift in perspective that allows for the discovery of new possibilities and a renewed sense of interest and engagement.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The figure symbolizes introspection and contemplation, suggesting a period of deep thought and reflection.
The three cups symbolize existing opportunities or blessings, suggesting that there is much to be grateful for and to consider.
The offered cup symbolizes new opportunities or possibilities that may be overlooked if one is too focused on what is already known or familiar.
The tree symbolizes growth and vitality, suggesting that new opportunities may lead to personal growth and development.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes introspection and contemplation, suggesting a focus on inner thoughts and feelings.
Green symbolizes growth and renewal, suggesting that new opportunities may lead to personal growth and positive change.
Yellow symbolizes positivity and optimism, suggesting that new opportunities may bring about positive outcomes.
Red symbolizes passion and action, suggesting that new opportunities may require boldness and action to pursue.

cardDescription: The Five of Cups shows a figure mourning over three spilled cups, unaware of two upright cups behind them. It symbolizes loss, regret, and focusing on the negative.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Five of Cups represents loss, regret, disappointment, focusing on the negative, and sadness. It suggests a period of mourning or sadness over past events or losses, often accompanied by a sense of regret or disappointment.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Five of Cups can indicate acceptance, moving on, finding peace, forgiveness, or hope. It suggests a shift in perspective that allows for acceptance of past events and a willingness to move forward with renewed hope and optimism.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The figure in a cloak symbolizes sorrow or mourning, suggesting a period of sadness or regret.
The spilled cups symbolize loss or missed opportunities, suggesting a focus on what has been lost rather than what remains.
The upright cups behind the figure symbolize hidden blessings or opportunities that may be overlooked in the midst of grief or disappointment.
The river symbolizes the flow of emotions, suggesting that it is natural to experience sadness or loss but also to allow emotions to flow and eventually find peace.

prominentColors.meaning: Black symbolizes mourning or darkness, suggesting a period of sadness or loss.
Blue symbolizes sadness or contemplation, suggesting a focus on emotions and reflection.
Red symbolizes passion or strong emotions, suggesting intense feelings of regret or loss.
Green symbolizes growth or renewal, suggesting that even in times of sadness, there is the potential for growth and new beginnings.

cardDescription: The Six of Cups depicts two children sharing cups filled with flowers, symbolizing nostalgia, innocence, and childhood memories.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Six of Cups represents nostalgia, innocence, childhood memories, joy, and simplicity. It suggests a return to simpler times or a focus on happy memories from the past. It can also indicate a need to reconnect with your inner child or approach life with a more innocent and playful attitude.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Six of Cups can indicate being stuck in the past, naivety, unrealistic expectations, growing up, or letting go of the past. It suggests a need to let go of outdated beliefs or behaviors that may be holding you back from moving forward.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The two children symbolize innocence, purity, and a playful attitude.
The cups filled with flowers symbolize joy, beauty, and the simple pleasures of life.
The village in the background symbolizes community, belonging, and a sense of home.
The guard symbolizes protection, suggesting a need to protect your inner child or cherished memories.

prominentColors.meaning: Yellow symbolizes happiness, warmth, and positivity, reflecting the joyful nature of the card.
Green symbolizes growth, renewal, and nature, reflecting the innocence and naturalness of childhood.
Blue symbolizes peace, tranquility, and emotional depth, suggesting a sense of calm and contentment in nostalgic memories.
Red symbolizes passion, vitality, and energy, suggesting the vibrant and lively nature of childhood experiences.

cardDescription: The Seven of Cups shows a figure facing a cloud of cups filled with various symbols, representing choices, illusions, and imagination.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Seven of Cups represents choices, illusions, imagination, fantasy, and wishful thinking. It suggests that you may be faced with many options or opportunities, but not all may be as they seem. It can also indicate a need to focus on what is truly important and not get lost in daydreams or unrealistic expectations.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Seven of Cups can indicate clarity, decision-making, seeing through illusions, and facing reality. It suggests that you are gaining a clearer perspective and are able to make more informed decisions. It can also indicate a need to be more grounded and practical in your approach.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The figure represents the person facing the choices and illusions presented by the cups.
The cloud of cups represents the many options or opportunities available, each filled with different symbols.
The various symbols in the cups represent the different choices or illusions, which can include material wealth, love, power, and other desires.
The mist represents the uncertainty and confusion that can come from facing too many choices or illusions.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes dreams, intuition, and spirituality, suggesting the dream-like nature of the choices and illusions.
Yellow symbolizes optimism, happiness, and energy, reflecting the positive and hopeful aspects of wishful thinking.
Red symbolizes passion, desire, and action, suggesting the strong emotions and desires associated with the choices presented.
Green symbolizes growth, fertility, and abundance, suggesting the potential for growth and new opportunities among the choices.

cardDescription: The Eight of Cups depicts a figure walking away from a stack of cups, symbolizing moving on, letting go, and seeking deeper meaning.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Eight of Cups represents moving on, letting go, seeking deeper meaning, and disillusionment. It suggests that you may be leaving behind something that no longer serves you in search of a deeper emotional fulfillment or spiritual purpose. It can also indicate a need to listen to your inner voice and follow your intuition.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Eight of Cups can indicate stagnation, fear of change, clinging to the past, and indecision. It suggests that you may be hesitant to let go of the past or move on from a situation, even though it may no longer be beneficial for you. It can also indicate a need to confront your fears and make a decision to move forward.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The walking figure represents the act of moving on and seeking something more fulfilling.
The stack of cups represents the emotional baggage or attachments that the figure is leaving behind.
The moon symbolizes the unconscious mind, suggesting that the figure is guided by their intuition and inner feelings.
The river represents the flow of emotions and the journey toward deeper understanding.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes introspection, wisdom, and truth, reflecting the inner journey of self-discovery.
Brown symbolizes grounding, stability, and the earth, suggesting the need to stay grounded during times of change.
Yellow symbolizes enlightenment, optimism, and joy, indicating the potential for spiritual growth and new beginnings.
Red symbolizes passion, energy, and action, suggesting the courage and determination needed to move forward.

cardDescription: The Nine of Cups shows a figure sitting in front of a row of cups, symbolizing contentment, satisfaction, and emotional fulfillment.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Nine of Cups represents contentment, satisfaction, emotional fulfillment, gratitude, and wish fulfillment. It suggests that you are in a state of emotional satisfaction and have achieved a sense of fulfillment in your life. It can also indicate that your wishes and desires are coming true, bringing you joy and happiness.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Nine of Cups can indicate dissatisfaction, materialism, smugness, and unfulfilled wishes. It suggests that you may be focusing too much on material possessions or external validation, leading to a lack of true emotional fulfillment. It can also indicate a need to reevaluate your desires and priorities to find true happiness.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The seated figure represents contentment and satisfaction with what has been achieved.
The row of cups symbolizes emotional fulfillment and the abundance of positive emotions.
The curtained backdrop suggests that emotional fulfillment is an internal state, not dependent on external circumstances.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes calmness, tranquility, and emotional stability, reflecting the figure's emotional state.
Yellow symbolizes happiness, optimism, and joy, indicating the figure's positive emotional state.
Red symbolizes passion, desire, and fulfillment, reflecting the emotional richness of the scene.
White symbolizes purity, clarity, and spiritual fulfillment, suggesting a sense of inner peace and harmony.

cardDescription: The Ten of Cups depicts a happy family with a rainbow of cups in the sky, symbolizing harmony, joy, and emotional contentment.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Ten of Cups represents harmony, joy, family happiness, emotional contentment, and fulfillment. It suggests that you are experiencing a period of emotional satisfaction and happiness, particularly within your family and close relationships. It can also indicate a sense of peace and contentment with your current life circumstances.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Ten of Cups can indicate a broken family, disharmony, lack of emotional connection, and disillusionment. It suggests that there may be challenges or conflicts within your family or close relationships, leading to feelings of unhappiness or discontent. It can also indicate a need to reevaluate your emotional needs and priorities to find true happiness.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The happy family symbolizes harmony, joy, and emotional fulfillment within family relationships.
The rainbow of cups symbolizes emotional abundance, happiness, and the fulfillment of emotional desires.
The home symbolizes a safe and nurturing environment where emotional fulfillment can be found.
The green landscape symbolizes growth, abundance, and prosperity, reflecting the emotional richness of the scene.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes calmness, tranquility, and emotional stability, reflecting the harmonious nature of the scene.
Green symbolizes growth, abundance, and prosperity, indicating the emotional richness of the family's life.
Yellow symbolizes happiness, optimism, and joy, reflecting the family's emotional state.
Red symbolizes passion, love, and emotional intensity, suggesting the deep emotional connections within the family.

cardDescription: The Page of Cups shows a young figure holding a cup with a fish in it, symbolizing curiosity, creativity, and emotional beginnings.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Page of Cups represents curiosity, creativity, emotional beginnings, intuition, and new opportunities. It suggests that you are open to exploring your emotions and creative ideas, and you may be at the beginning of a new emotional or creative journey. It can also indicate the emergence of intuitive insights and the potential for new emotional experiences.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Page of Cups can indicate emotional immaturity, creative blocks, moodiness, and insecurity. It suggests that you may be struggling to express your emotions or creative ideas effectively, leading to feelings of frustration or insecurity. It can also indicate a need to work through emotional issues or insecurities to allow for personal growth and creative expression.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The young figure symbolizes youthfulness, innocence, and a fresh perspective.
The cup with a fish symbolizes emotional depth, intuition, and the subconscious mind.
The waves symbolize the ebb and flow of emotions, reflecting the emotional nature of the Page.
The floral hat symbolizes creativity, imagination, and the potential for new ideas.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes calmness, tranquility, and emotional depth, reflecting the emotional nature of the card.
Yellow symbolizes happiness, optimism, and creativity, suggesting the potential for new beginnings.
Pink symbolizes love, compassion, and emotional sensitivity, reflecting the emotional depth of the Page.
White symbolizes purity, innocence, and a fresh start, suggesting the youthfulness of the Page.

cardDescription: The Knight of Cups rides gracefully on a horse, holding a cup, symbolizing charm, romance, and a quest for emotional fulfillment.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Knight of Cups represents charm, romance, idealism, artistic nature, and following the heart. It suggests that you may be in touch with your emotions and are willing to express them in a creative or romantic way. It can also indicate a quest for emotional fulfillment and a willingness to pursue your dreams and desires.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Knight of Cups can indicate moodiness, disillusionment, unrealistic expectations, and jealousy. It suggests that you may be overly focused on romantic ideals or artistic pursuits, leading to feelings of disappointment or dissatisfaction. It can also indicate a need to be more realistic in your approach to relationships and creative endeavors.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The knight symbolizes action, adventure, and the pursuit of ideals, reflecting the Knight's quest for emotional fulfillment.
The horse symbolizes power, strength, and grace, reflecting the Knight's graceful and charming nature.
The cup symbolizes emotions, intuition, and the heart, reflecting the Knight's emotional depth and romantic nature.
The river symbolizes emotions, flow, and movement, reflecting the Knight's emotional and creative energy.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes calmness, tranquility, and emotional depth, reflecting the emotional nature of the Knight.
Yellow symbolizes happiness, optimism, and creativity, suggesting the Knight's idealistic nature.
Red symbolizes passion, desire, and romance, reflecting the Knight's romantic nature.
White symbolizes purity, innocence, and spirituality, suggesting the Knight's pure intentions.

cardDescription: The Queen of Cups sits on a throne by the sea, holding an ornate cup. She symbolizes compassion, intuition, and emotional security.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the Queen of Cups represents compassion, intuition, emotional security, nurturing, and empathy. It suggests that you are emotionally balanced and in tune with your feelings and the feelings of others. You may be a source of comfort and support for those around you, and you approach life with kindness and understanding.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the Queen of Cups can indicate emotional insecurity, codependency, manipulation, and moodiness. It suggests that you may be struggling with your emotions or relying too heavily on others for emotional support. It can also indicate a need to be more aware of your own feelings and boundaries.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The queen symbolizes compassion, nurturing, and emotional depth, reflecting the Queen's empathetic nature.
The throne symbolizes authority, power, and stability, reflecting the Queen's emotional security.
The ornate cup symbolizes emotions, intuition, and spirituality, reflecting the Queen's deep emotional connection.
The sea symbolizes emotions, depth, and the subconscious mind, reflecting the Queen's emotional depth and intuition.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes calmness, tranquility, and emotional depth, reflecting the Queen's emotional stability.
Yellow symbolizes happiness, optimism, and creativity, suggesting the Queen's nurturing and empathetic nature.
Red symbolizes passion, desire, and emotion, reflecting the Queen's emotional intensity.
White symbolizes purity, innocence, and spirituality, suggesting the Queen's pure intentions.

cardDescription: The King of Cups sits on a throne surrounded by water, holding a cup and a scepter. He represents emotional balance, diplomacy, and wisdom.

meanings.title: Upright Meaning
meanings.description: In the upright position, the King of Cups represents emotional balance, diplomacy, wisdom, calmness, and fairness. It suggests that you are in control of your emotions and are able to approach situations with empathy and understanding. You may be seen as a peacemaker and a source of stability for others.

meanings.title: Reversed Meaning
meanings.description: In the reversed position, the King of Cups can indicate emotional manipulation, volatility, detachment, and moodiness. It suggests that you may be struggling to control your emotions or may be using them to manipulate others. It can also indicate a need to be more in touch with your feelings and to express them in a healthy way.

prominentSymbols.meaning: The king symbolizes authority, leadership, and control, reflecting the King's emotional maturity and stability.
The throne symbolizes authority, power, and stability, reflecting the King's emotional control and balance.
The cup symbolizes emotions, intuition, and spirituality, reflecting the King's deep emotional understanding.
The scepter symbolizes authority, leadership, and control, reflecting the King's emotional authority.
Water symbolizes emotions, intuition, and the subconscious mind, reflecting the King's deep emotional connection.

prominentColors.meaning: Blue symbolizes calmness, tranquility, and emotional depth, reflecting the King's emotional stability.
Yellow symbolizes happiness, optimism, and creativity, suggesting the King's emotional warmth and openness.
Red symbolizes passion, desire, and emotion, reflecting the King's emotional intensity.
Green symbolizes growth, healing, and balance, suggesting the King's emotional maturity and balance.

cardDescription: The Ace of Swords depicts a hand holding a sword upright, symbolizing clarity, breakthroughs, and new ideas.
cardUprightMeaning: Clarity, breakthroughs, new ideas, mental clarity, truth.
cardReverseMeaning: Confusion, misinformation, lack of clarity, indecision.

cardDescription: The Two of Swords shows a blindfolded figure holding two crossed swords, symbolizing indecision, stalemate, and blocked emotions.
cardUprightMeaning: Indecision, stalemate, blocked emotions, denial, truce.
cardReverseMeaning: Clarity, decision-making, resolution of conflict, openness.

cardDescription: The Three of Swords depicts a heart pierced by three swords, representing heartbreak, sorrow, and betrayal.
cardUprightMeaning: Heartbreak, sorrow, betrayal, loss, painful separation.
cardReverseMeaning: Healing, reconciliation, forgiveness, release of pain.

cardDescription: The Four of Swords shows a figure lying in repose, with swords hanging above. It represents rest, recovery, and contemplation.
cardUprightMeaning: Rest, recovery, contemplation, meditation, peace.
cardReverseMeaning: Exhaustion, burnout, stress, restlessness, lack of progress.

cardDescription: The Five of Swords depicts a figure holding three swords while two others are discarded, symbolizing conflict, betrayal, and winning at all costs.
cardUprightMeaning: Conflict, betrayal, loss, winning at all costs, tension.
cardReverseMeaning: Reconciliation, making amends, past resentments, forgiveness.

cardDescription: The Six of Swords shows a figure being ferried across water, symbolizing transition, moving on, and finding solace.
cardUprightMeaning: Transition, moving on, finding solace, journey to a calmer place.
cardReverseMeaning: Stagnation, emotional baggage, unresolved issues, resistance to change.

cardDescription: The Seven of Swords depicts a figure sneaking away with five swords, leaving two behind, symbolizing deception, strategy, and evasion.
cardUprightMeaning: Deception, strategy, stealth, tactics, resourcefulness.
cardReverseMeaning: Coming clean, facing consequences, honesty, confession.

cardDescription: The Eight of Swords shows a blindfolded figure surrounded by swords, symbolizing feeling trapped, restricted, and self-imposed limitations.
cardUprightMeaning: Feeling trapped, restricted, self-imposed limitations, victim mentality.
cardReverseMeaning: Self-liberation, release, overcoming obstacles, new perspective.
